name: EDR III / Dev Crit DwD - A Viable Option?
author: Stagmeister

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello all, only me again.

I've just returned from a retro excursion into Baldur's Gate, and quite fancied the idea of the above. I'm not being lazy, but for reasons best known to itself, neither the Legacy Archive nor Hip's Fantabulous Contrapulator seems to be playing nicely with me at the moment, so I don't know if there's anything that works out there atm.

Plus I'm full of flu currently, so my brain isn't functioning even at its normal level of incompetence.

Thus...can any of you good folk come up with a Dwarven Defender with both EDR III and Devastating Crit that doesn't make it too underpowered to play?

Thanks in advance

Might I ask a question, please? You take two levels of CoT at level 19 and 20, and I wondered whether the +1 bump to saves was the only reason (along with the bonus feat), rather than two more levels of DwD pre-epic and then either the CoT levels in epic for Epic Weapon Specialization? Is DwD one of those classes you can only take 10 levels in pre-epic? I'm sure I'm missing something, but I'm not sure what.

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: He takes 20 epic DD levels to reach DD 30. The last DD level gives a bonus feat and an additional 3/- DR.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote: He takes 20 epic DD levels to reach DD 30. The last DD level gives a bonus feat and an additional 3/- DR.
Sorry, Mick, but I wasn't suggesting not hitting DwD 30, just doing 18 of them in epic rather than 20. Hence the question...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Then you would have to take 12 DD levels pre epic. You can only take 10 levels of a prestige class pre epic.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Ah, now that chimes with my second initial question. When not doing it yourself, sometimes one loses track. Excellent, Mick, many thanks, as ever!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: You're welcome Stag!
